newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Jakarta shares close up on foreign buying, Telkom.
newsitem.headline: Jakarta shares close up on foreign buying, Telkom.

text.p: The Jakarta composite index closed sharply higher on Wednesday following foreign buying of selected market heavyweights and local targeting of secondaries, brokers said.
The index rose 9.10 points, or 1.57 percent, to close at the day-high of 589.31 points. Gainers led losers 71 to 49, with 46 counters unchanged.

"If the Dow makes gains tonight, foreigners are likely to continue buying on Thursday," a broker with a Japanese brokerage firm said. "But today's gains was boosted by the rise of Telkom, which improved overall market sentiment," she added.
Cross-trading amounting to 885.26 billion rupiah pushed total transactions to 1.151 trillion rupiah.
Lippo Bank, Lippo Life and Lippo Securities of the Lippo Group dominated the cross-trading along with Telkom and Astra International, brokers said.

Brokers said the surge in Telkom was due to speculation that Deutsche Telekom might be looking for a stake in the company. Company officials denied the rumours but said joint venture firm PT Satelindo, in which Deutsche Telekom has a 25 percent stake, is likely to join hands with Telkom to jointly acquire and operate the new generation Palapa D satellite.
